questions.question_text: Karoḍ kām bagāḍīne paṇ shu sudhārvo ne kadāpi karoḍ kām sudhāryā ne ek mokṣha bagāḍyo to temā shu karyu?
questions.explanation: According to Swamini Vato 1/14, one should focus on improving their moksha even if it means spoiling other tasks.

questions.question_text: Ā meḍiyu maḷī chhe ne sāru sāru khāvā maḷe chhe, ke mān maḷe chhe, ityādik manuṣhya dehnu shu nathī. Te to vimukhne paṇ maḷe chhe.
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato 2/19 states that merely getting good food or respect is not the purpose of human life.

questions.question_text: Māṭe manuṣhya dehnu faḷ to shu ne swabhāv ṭaḷe, eṭalu ja chhe.
questions.explanation: According to Swamini Vato 2/19, the true fruit of human life is associating with good people and overcoming one's nature.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇe paṇ e Akṣharrūp je mukta temanī panktimā shu chhe ane Akṣhardhāmmā jaīne akhanḍ Bhagwānnī sevāmā hajūr rahevu chhe...
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Gadhada Pratham 21 explains the goal to merge into the Aksharrup and remain in the service of Bhagwan.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇo janma be vāt sādhavā sāru thayo chhe, temā ek Akṣharrūp thāvu, emā deh antarāyrūp chhe; ne bīju Bhagwānmā joḍāvu, temā shu antarāyrūp chhe.
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato 4/99 states that our birth is to achieve two things: to become Aksharrup, in which the body is an obstacle, and to unite with Bhagwan, in which association is an obstacle.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇo janma be vāt sādhavā sāru thayo chhe, temā ek Akṣharrūp thāvu, emā deh antarāyrūp chhe; ne bīju Bhagwānmā joḍāvu, temā sang anek prakārnā antarāyrūp chhe. E be shu ṭaḷavī.
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato 4/99 emphasizes the need to eliminate these two shortcomings (be khot): the body as an obstacle to becoming Aksharrup and association as an obstacle to uniting with Bhagwan.

questions.question_text: “...marī to sarvene javu chhe paṇ āvī rīte bhakti karavī e ja shu chhe...”
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Gadhada Antya 30 states that to die is inevitable for everyone but to practice bhakti in this way is the great gain of life

questions.question_text: Nāshvant ā deh vadhethi, avinashi shu levu ji, patrāvaane jemi karine, bahaar feki devu ji
questions.explanation: Narayandas Swami's kirtan speaks of obtaining the eternal fruit (avinashi fal) from this perishable body.

questions.question_text: Karoḍ kām bagāḍīne paṇ ek mokṣha sudhārvo ne kadāpi karoḍ kām sudhāryā ne ek shu bagāḍyo to temā shu karyu?
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato 1/14 emphasizes the importance of moksha, stating that even spoiling numerous tasks to improve one's moksha is worthwhile, but spoiling moksha after improving numerous tasks is futile.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇe paṇ e Akṣharrūp je mukta temanī panktimā bhaḷavu chhe ane Akṣhardhāmmā jaīne akhanḍ Bhagwānnī sevāmā hajūr rahevu chhe, paṇ shu ne tuchchh evu je māyik sukh tene ichchhavu nathī ne emā koī ṭhekāṇe lobhāvu nathī.
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Gadhada Pratham 21 describes how one should not desire perishable (nashvant) and trivial (tuchchh) mayik pleasures.
